headline.print_headline: Fat Comes In on Little Cat Feet
headline.main: Fat Comes in on Little Cat Feet

docs.lead_paragraph: If your close friend gains a significant amount of weight, you have a 171 percent greater chance of becoming obese, too.
docs.snippet: If your close friend gains a significant amount of weight, you have a 171 percent greater chance of becoming obese, too.

docs.lead_paragraph: Because of new technology, ultra-athletes with Type 1 diabetes are running marathons, doing 100-mile bike rides and completing Ironmen — many with their doctor’s blessing.
docs.snippet: Because of new technology, ultra-athletes with Type 1 diabetes are running marathons, doing 100-mile bike rides and completing Ironmen — many with their doctor’s blessing.

headline.print_headline: Find Yourself Packing It On? Look Around at Your Friends
headline.main: Find Yourself Packing It On? Blame Friends

docs.lead_paragraph: Obesity can spread from person to person, much like a virus, researchers report.
docs.snippet: Obesity can spread from person to person, much like a virus, researchers report.

docs.abstract: It was only a few years ago that I first noticed an obese person in a commercial. Then there were more. Now, like obesity itself, it has gotten out of hand. This disturbs me in ways I haven't fully figured out, and in a few that I have. The obese man on the orange bench, [...]

docs.abstract: Obesity often is described as a modern-day epidemic, but only now have scientists found evidence that it spreads from person to person. After studying the social connections and body composition of nearly 12,000 people participating in the Framingham Heart Study over three decades, researchers at Harvard Medical School found that subjects were at greatly increased [...]
docs.lead_paragraph: Obesity often is described as a modern-day epidemic, but only now have scientists found evidence that it spreads from person to person. After studying the social connections and body composition of nearly 12,000 people participating in the Framingham Heart Study over three decades, researchers at Harvard Medical School found that subjects were at greatly increased risk of becoming obese if they had friends who were themselves obese.
docs.snippet: Obesity often is described as a modern-day epidemic, but only now have scientists found evidence that it spreads from person to person. After studying the social connections and body composition of nearly 12,000 people participating in the Framingham...

docs.lead_paragraph: An animation illustrates how social networks facilitated the spread of obesity over 32 years among participants in the Framingham Heart Study. (Source: The New England Journal of Medicine)
docs.snippet: An animation illustrates how social networks facilitated the spread of obesity over 32 years among participants in the Framingham Heart Study. (Source: The New England Journal of Medicine)

headline.main: Study Says Obesity Can Be Contagious

docs.lead_paragraph: When a person gains weight, close friends tend to gain weight, too, researchers found.
docs.snippet: When a person gains weight, close friends tend to gain weight, too, researchers found.

headline.seo: Transcript of the CNN/YouTube Democratic Debate

docs.lead_paragraph: The eight candidates vying to be the Democrat nominee for president in the 2008 elections answered questions submitted by CNN and YouTube users in a debate. Participants: Senator Joseph Biden, Jr. (D-De); Senator Hillary Clinton (D-N.Y.); Senator Christopher Dodd (D-Conn.); Former Senator John Edwards (D-S.C.); Former Senator Mike Gravel (D-AK); Representative Dennis Kucinich (D-OH); Senator Barack Obama (D-IL); and Governor Bill Richardson (D-NM). Moderator: Anderson Cooper, CNN host. Location: the Citadel, Charleston, S.C. Monday, July 23, 2007. Here is a full transcript of the event, from CNN:.
